div.p: 1. The most current general word for "why" is probably xī 奚.
2. Hé yǐ 何以 typically asks for a reason in the form of a purpose, but the word can also ask for a good intellectual reason, as in hé yǐ zhī zhī 何以知之 "how do you know".
3. Hú 胡 is a dialect word which often asks generally for reasons and is hard to distinguish semantically from xī 奚.
4. Hé 盍 "why not" is a contracted form of hé bù 何不.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／ LU JIANMING

note.p: cur introduces both genuine and rhetorical questions.
Wang Haifen lists and analyses over 120 related words!

sense.def: Why is that? why is it the case that S?; why is it so?, what is the reason of it?......,何也?
why on earth? (one surely does not know why!)
what is the reason for N?

entry.def: The most current general word for "why" is probably xī 奚.

sense.def: why should one, why should he?
read nìng: why? (i.e.: for no good reason)

entry.def: Hé 盍 "why not" is a contracted form of hé bù 何不.
Hú 胡 is a dialect word which often asks generally for reasons and is hard to distinguish semantically from xī 奚.

sense.def: why is it that...; in what respect is it that
Why on earth? (i.e. for no good reason, for no reason whatsoever)
Why is that? Why was that?

entry.def: Hé yǐ 何以 typically asks for a reason in the form of a purpose, but the word can also ask for a good intellectual reason, as in hé yǐ zhī zhī 何以知之 "how do you know".

sense.def: why on earth? surely for no good reason!
How? (answer NO there is no explanation, one should not, they should not...!!!)

bibl.title: Studies in the Language of Zǔtáng jí 祖堂集

note.p: This compound is also used in BIANWEN. In ZTJ there is only one example for the meaning 'why'. In the other occurrences he2yi4 is used in its literary meaning 'have what meaning'.
It is possibly a graphic variant of 何以.

bibl.title: 近代漢語研究概況 Jìndài hànyǔ yánjiū gàikuàng A Survey Study on Early Mandarin

note.p: possibly a garphic variant of 何以

sense.def: why? (i.e. surely for no good subjective reason)
why? (i.e. for no good objective reason)
for what reason? (surely one does not know!)
Why should one get to V? [One will have to look for more examples]
What for?! For what reason?! On what grounds?!
why?, for what reason?, what's the point?

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: why, for what reason, for what perpose
Why? i.e. surely there is no reason! Mo: 吾言何遽不善？
why should one V, what need is there to V > one should not V
Tang: what is the reason for this? why is that so? what's the point of? (the usage as predicate is rare and usually 作摩 is suffixed with 生) (precursor of Modern Mandarin 怎麼)
why is it? what is the point of? what is the purpose of?

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: why go on to? (expected answer: there is no reason to go on to...)
because of what > why; for what reason
Why? how come? (i.e. for no good reason!)
why (presupposed answer: for no good reason)
And why is that so? (placed between S1 and S2, and S2 is explanatory of S1)
why is it so> what is the point, how about this; what is the purpose (often following topicalized VP or S)
why is it so> what is the point, how about this; what is the purpose (often following a topicalized VP or S)
archaic interrogative pronoun/adverb in SHI, obviously a loan character
why on earth? (surely one does not know why!)
why on earth? (surely one does not know why!)
to what purpose?, with what concrete aim?
why was it that S? sometimes emphatically doubtful: how (on earth) was it that S?
